description.narrative: The project will support 16,481 extremely vulnerable girls aged 4-19 to attend school and transition from primary into secondary and higher education or TVET, overcoming barriers to education such as early marriage, child migration, sexual abuse and exploitation. They will access learning, knowledge and skills necessary to enable the realisation of their full-potential.

participating-org.narrative: Organisation for Child Development and Transformation (CHADET)

mailing-address.narrative: ChildHope UK The Green House 244-254 Cambridge Heath Road London E2 9DA

sector.narrative: Remove economic barriers that prevent girls marginalised by early marriage, domestic labour, risky child migration and/or street-living to enrol and stay longer in primary education. Targeted marginalised girls who are supported to enrol in primary education learn useful knowledge and skills.

Remove economic barriers that prevent girls marginalised by early marriage, domestic labour, risky child migration and/or street-living to transition and stay longer in TVET. Targeted marginalised girls who are supported to enrol in TVET learn useful knowledge and skills.

Remove economic barriers that prevent girls marginalised by early marriage, domestic labour, risky child migration and/or street-living to transition and stay longer in secondary education. Targeted marginalised girls who are supported to enrol in secondary education learn useful knowledge and skills.
